taskDescription:
A sequence is known to be arithmetic. Two of the terms are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>a</mi>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mn>14</mn>
      </mrow>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>41</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{a_{14}} = 41</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>a</mi>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mn>38</mn>
      </mrow>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>161</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{a_{38}} = 161</annotation></semantics></math> . Use that information to find the constant difference and the first term. Then determine the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mn>151</mn>
    <mtext>st</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{151\text{st}}</annotation></semantics></math> term of the sequence.
detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>d</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">d = 5</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>a</mi>
      <mn>1</mn>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>24</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{a_1} =  - 24</annotation></semantics></math> , and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>a</mi>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mn>151</mn>
      </mrow>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>726</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{a_{151}} = 726</annotation></semantics></math>
